basics.name: Charlie Kelly
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Senior Software Engineer with over 12 years experience in all aspects of software development, including requirements analysis, unit and functional testing, creating complete and understandable documentation, and performing peer review analysis. Dedicated to creating accurate software that meets or exceeds all client requirements, while also providing sustainability for future enhancements. Committed to inspiring myself and my colleagues to continue to grow in the profession.

work.name: Ameritas
work.summary: Technical lead for team developing internal data microservices
highlights: Led 4 Java developers to build Spring Boot microservices app that handles $15M/week in agent compensation, based on data from multiple sources including SFTP, REST, SOAP, and SQL
Created new project architecture (Spring Boot + RabbitMQ) allowing rapid development of new data services
Developed build pipeline (BitBucket, Gradle, Jenkins, JUnit, SonarQube, NexusIQ, Docker, and Kubernetes) for getting JIRA requirements to QA on schedule
Devised and enforced code standards, Git procedures, and test coverage requirements for my team

work.name: Percussion Software
work.summary: Engineered solutions for Percussion CMS customers, ranging from small colleges to Social Security Administration
highlights: Primary engineer on $80M federal contract to migrate two SSA subdomains to Azure Cloud, plus 4 legacy J2EE apps; re-engineered site search functionality using JSP and search.gov
Built custom integration to synchronize customer’s LDAP with CMS directory, using Java REST client; wrote extensive unit and integration tests plus deployment
Provided daily expert support for 30+ institutional and government CMS customers
Created and executed QA scripts for product features and upgrades

work.name: Association for Autism and Neurodiversity
highlights: Provided operational and development support for technical needs of non-proﬁt, including network management, system integration, and website maintenance
Dramatically improved information security by implementing and administering password management and centralized authentication rules

work.name: Costedio Design
work.summary: Cofounder and technical director for small web design firm
highlights: Designed and built 23 different sites for small business and non-proﬁt customers, using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and JQuery, as well as WordPress
Worked with customers to analyze goals and discuss options for a range of budgets
Directed and oversaw duties of additional web programmers and subcontractors
Participated in creative design process and choosing best technology for each project

work.name: OpenService
work.summary: Principal front-end developer for network security and threat detection suite
highlights: Responsible for UI for two major releases of flagship security product
Converted applet-based interface into new platform using Java Server Faces
Spearheaded migration of product from applets to AJAX, resulting in signiﬁcant improvement in customer satisfaction

work.name: MediaSurface
work.summary: Rebuilt public-facing news site on proprietary CMS platform
highlights: Worked with project team to design and implement public-facing website for Thomson/Reuters
Collaborated with consultants and client employees to build brand new public website for multinational media giant within narrow timeframe

work.name: Coface Services
work.summary: Developed multiple internal business applications for credit insurance agency
highlights: Developed over 20 internal business applications, ranging from MS Ofﬁce-based apps to company-wide, web-accessible solutions built on Oracle and J2EE

volunteer.summary: A volunteer civic innovation organization, part of the Code for America Brigades
highlights: Contributed to multiple community projects, both by writing code to solve speciﬁc problems and by reviewing PRs and documenting issues
Participated in rigorous Agile process for project development; encouraged professional standards among other contributors
Assisted in onboarding new volunteers, explaining workﬂows and mentoring junior developers

projects.name: CantImagineWhy
highlights: Expanded bootcamp project to include UX team to create web application to display original artwork
Leveraged existing free-tier frameworks and APIs to eliminate backend costs

projects.name: Ticket to Work (SSA)
highlights: Migrated site content for 2 subdomains to Azure Cloud (choosework.ssa.gov and yourtickettowork.ssa.gov)
Rebuilt multiple custom J2EE web apps
Configured and thoroughly tested IIS access rules
Successfully passed FedRAMP certification

projects.name: Ticket-To-Work Search (SSA)
highlights: Replaced clunky SOLR/Nutch implementation
Created Search.gov consumer to perform search without backend

projects.name: Work Incentive Seminar Events (SSA)
highlights: One of several custom webapps rebuilt as part of SSA migration
Allows disability recipients to sign up for webinars
Tomcat-based app links to Adobe Connect

projects.name: TTW FindHelp (SSA)
highlights: Helps disability recipients locate rehabilitation services based on search criteria
Runs on Wildfly server connected to Oracle sources

projects.name: National Police Data Coalition (Code for Boston)
projects.description: A national archive of police data collected by journalists, lawyers, and activists around the country.
highlights: Authored multiple React TypeScript components
Created Storybook integration and defined acceptance guidelines

projects.name: Community Connect (Code for Boston)
projects.description: A tool for connecting those in need to services or materials that improve their quality of life.
highlights: App uses Google Sheet as data source
Provides local resources to clients from simple URL; no user data is ever stored
